Extracting DNA from Cheek Cells
Honors Biology students, mostly ninth-graders, chewed gently on the insides of their cheeks for 30 seconds to obtain enough cells to deposit in test tubes for DNA. After collecting the sample, they break open the cells with the addition of lysis, remove the proteins with the addition of a protease and salt solution, place in a warm bath, and finally make the DNA visible in about 5 minutes by pipetting cold alcohol into the sample.

Norma Lanier, former GMHS PE Teacher and Program Coordinator for the Extended Day Care has passed away. From 1955 to 1962, she was a pioneer in pushing to create sports programs for girls as a P.E. teacher at George Mason High School. She led the girls' basketball team to the championship during the 1957-1958 season. In 2015 she was honored as a Falls Church Visionary for her work as the Director of Extended Daycare for Falls Church Public Schools, where she worked from 1987 until her retirement in 1993.

In his annual remarks during the FCCPS 2019 Convocation, Superintendent Peter J. Noonan outlined the Division's goals for the coming year; creating a caring culture, closing achievement gaps, and overcoming the "structural inequality by race, class, and gender."

"It is not OK for any student to be marginalized, allowing some to miss the mark," he said. "Our goal must be to widen our lens. School is one part of the ecosystem of the disenfranchised, and it must provide hope and the promise of betterment. This confronts us as a moral imperative."
